citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).
citations.narrative:
An IACUC investigation documented two occurrences of off-protocol activities involving NonHuman Primates (NHPs):
--Unapproved blood draws were conducted on three NHPs on three occasions in May 2023.
--A substance not approved for use in the protocol was administered to three NHPs on two occasions in April/May 2023.
Performing activities not covered by IACUC-approved protocols can result in harm or death to the impacted animals. The
regulations state that with respect to activities involving animals, the IACUC, as an agent of the research facility, shall
review and approve, require modifications in (to secure approval), or withhold approval of proposed significant changes
regarding the care and use of animals in ongoing activities. Corrected prior to inspection.

citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care.
citations.narrative:
Two actions taken by one investigator that interfered with the Attending Veterinarian's (AV’s) authority were documented
by an IACUC investigation:
--Intentional exclusion of four macaques (out of a group of twenty) from a request from the AV staff regarding possible
animal exposure to a contaminated substance.
--Instruction of staff to flush iv catheters of two NHPs immediately prior to sampling by the AV staff, with the apparent
intent of obscuring culture results.
Intentionally interfering with the authority of the AV can lead to harm or death of the impacted animals. The regulations
state that each research facility shall assure that the attending veterinarian has appropriate authority to ensure the
provision of adequate veterinary care and to oversee the adequacy of other aspects of animal care and use. Corrected
prior to inspection.

citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care.
citations.narrative:
Three incidents of failure to communicate daily observations of animals regarding their health and well-being to the AV
staff were documented by IACUC investigations:
--An investigator failed to appropriately report an exposed subcutaneous vascular access port for four days when
observed in an NHP to the AV staff in October/November 2022. Another veterinarian reported the exposed port to the AV
staff, who then attended to the animal’s medical care.
--An investigator administered an off-protocol drug to a macaque in April 2023. The animal became excessively
hypothermic with marked sedation. The adverse event was not reported in a timely manner to the AV staff. The animal
recovered with adequate supportive care.
--A macaque sustained laceration injuries when it was improperly placed in the same enclosure with another NHP in
May2023. The animal incident was not reported to the AV staff and the injuries were discovered the following morning.
The animal required anesthesia to repair a four cm deep laceration with muscle involvement on the left chest and a one
cm superficial laceration on the head. The animal made a full recovery.
Not reporting daily observations regarding animal health and welfare concerns can put the animals’ health and lives at
risk. The regulations state that each research facility shall assure that the attending veterinarian has appropriate authority
to ensure the provision of adequate veterinary care and to oversee the adequacy of other aspects of animal care and use.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
Additional Inspectors:
CHRISTINA RADZAI, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n
